definition: to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: It's cheaper than to bring the partners here.
sentences.chinese: 这比带陪练过来要便宜得多。
提供代驾司机或陪练司机。

sentences.english: He ean have been delayed by fog.
sentences.chinese: 他可能被大雾外教口语陪练所耽误了。

sentences.english: Could you tell me how to go to the platform?
sentences.chinese: 你能告诉我到月台外教口语陪练怎么走吗？

sentences.english: "They need to go where the partners are," Gheorghe said.
sentences.chinese: “她们需要找有陪练的地方，”乔戈说。

sentences.english: How much does the ticket to London cost?
sentences.chinese: 去伦敦的火车票票外教口语陪练价多少？

sentences.english: Ask your training partners if you don't know.
sentences.chinese: 问你的陪练如果你还不知道。

definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
foreign teacher (abbr. for 外國教師|外国教师)/greenhorn/novice/amateurish/religion other than Buddhism (term used by Buddhists)
to team up (with)/to put a team together
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
